def: A combination of auric acid with a base; as, aurate orpotassium.
The person in whose favor a covenant is made.
Proof against penetration or permeation by water; impervious towater; as, a waterproof garment; a waterproof roof.
A thin slip of wood used to justify a page. [Obs.] Crabb.
To disburse anew; to give, or pay, back. Spenser.
In a congenial manner; as, congenially married or employed.

An act of endearment; any act or expression of affection; anembracing, or touching, with tenderness.Wooed her with his soft caresses. Langfellow.He exerted himself to win by indulgence and caresses the hearts ofall who were under his command. Macaulay.
After the manner of a court; elegant; polite; courtly.
A custom of the Celts, or an idiom of their language. Warton.
